DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Condition Code System PCORnet CDM Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A state of being, such as a state of health._A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes.:A state of being, such as a state of health._A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Condition Code System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A state of being, such as a state of health._A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A state of being, such as a state of health._A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes.

Concepts.definition: A state of being, such as a state of health.
A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PCORnet Common Data Model Condition Code System Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A data model designed to standardize PCORnet data._A state of being, such as a state of health._A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification/Procedure Coding System is the U.S. health system's adaptation of international ICD-9 standard list of six-character alphanumeric codes used in hospital inpatient settings for inpatient procedure coding.

Concepts.definition: The International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification/Procedure Coding System is the U.S. health system's adaptation of international ICD-9 standard list of six-character alphanumeric codes used in hospital inpatient settings for inpatient procedure coding.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification/Procedure Coding System is the U.S. health system's adaptation of international ICD-10 standard list of six-character alphanumeric codes used in hospital inpatient settings for inpatient procedure coding.

Concepts.definition: The International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification/Procedure Coding System is the U.S. health system's adaptation of international ICD-10 standard list of six-character alphanumeric codes used in hospital inpatient settings for inpatient procedure coding.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The International Classification of Diseases, Eleventh Revision, Clinical Modification/Procedure Coding System is the U.S. health system's adaptation of international ICD11 standard list of six-character alphanumeric codes used in hospital inpatient settings for inpatient procedure coding.

Concepts.definition: The International Classification of Diseases, Eleventh Revision, Clinical Modification/Procedure Coding System is the U.S. health system's adaptation of international ICD11 standard list of six-character alphanumeric codes used in hospital inpatient settings for inpatient procedure coding.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A defined procedure for solving a problem. Applied to a problem-solving procedure implemented in software to be executed by a computer.

Concepts.definition: A defined procedure for solving a problem. Applied to a problem-solving procedure implemented in software to be executed by a computer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A standardized vocabulary of phenotypic abnormalities encountered in human disease.

Concepts.definition: A standardized vocabulary of phenotypic abnormalities encountered in human disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

Concepts.definition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.

Concepts.longName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
Concepts.definition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
